issue.title: Make new entities and names in namespace std conforming extensions

discussion.p: Technically, right now, it is not a conforming extension to add a new function to namespace std. Doing so could cause unqualified lookup on the name of that function in the presence of a using directive to find a different function. This seems an unreasonable restriction on library vendors providing conforming extensions, as such a using directive seems inherently risky in unqualified name lookup.

implies that adding overloads to a method is a conforming extension, and within some limits the same is true for global functions due to .
It would likely be useful to specify that other new entities are valid conforming extensions, or preclude them where they pose serious compatibility problems.
